item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Alan Bennett
item.description: "What she was finding also was how one book led to another, doors kept opening wherever she turned and the days weren't long enough for the reading she wanted to do." -- Alan Bennett

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Leo Tolstoy
item.description: "He stepped down, trying not to look long at her, as if she were the sun, yet he saw her, like the sun, even without looking." -- Leo Tolstoy

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Christina Rossetti
item.description: "For there is no friend like a sister In calm or stormy weather; To cheer one on the tedious way, To fetch one if one goes astray, To lift one if one totters down, To strengthen whilst one stands" -- Christina Rossetti

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Hafez
item.description: "Ever since happiness heard your name, it has been running through the streets trying to find you." -- Hafez

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Clarissa Pinkola Estés
item.description: "Though her soul requires seeing, the culture around her requires sightlessness. Though her soul wishes to speak its truth, she is pressured to be silent." -- Clarissa Pinkola Estés

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Joseph Brodsky
item.description: "The surest defense against Evil is extreme individualism, originality of thinking, whimsicality, even—if you will—eccentricity." -- Joseph Brodsky

item.title: Vanessa add a quote by Walt Whitman
item.description: "I sound my barbaric yawp over the rooftops of the world." -- Walt Whitman
